issue.title: Wayland wallpaper
issue.body: Wpg does not set wallpaper on Wayland

comment.body: did this work?

issue.title: can't resize GUI window
issue.body:
Can't resize the main window below this size (see picture)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73885403/190190073-aa6a480c-5c5c-4d91-9a46-093914ae0a74.png)

comment.body: nice polybar/status bar, yeah I did not contemplate users changing the size of the window in any way, if you're on a tiling WM use floating window, I will mark this as a new feature but it is very low priority for me

issue.title: Keyword Set Flag
issue.body:
In issue #268 (closed) I was asking about being able to tie keyword sets to a color scheme. Currently (AFAIK) the only way to switch a keyword set is to open the GUI and select the set via the dropdown.

Perhaps adding a command line flag to choose the keyword set would be a good alternative? Maybe something like `-k`  and/or `--keyword-set ` ?

comment.body: this is possible yes, I can add a new keyword flag for this.

issue.title: Keywords per Colorscheme
issue.body:
Hello. I've seen #222 and saw that it was merged into master but don't see the changes in the current release v6.5.5.
Is this feature still being worked on? 

Also wanted to say thanks for all of the hard work that you have put into this project. Thank you!

issue.title: Keywords per Colorscheme
issue.body:
Hello. I've seen #222 and saw that it was merged into master but don't see the changes in the current release v6.5.5.
Is this feature still being worked on? 

Also wanted to say thanks for all of the hard work that you have put into this project. Thank you!

comment.body:
@mattyrc hey, I double checked, I remembered I switched keywords per colorscheme to be user defined instead, so instead of having 1:1 key/values per colorscheme you can name your set of keywords and have plenty of them, check the wiki for more information

https://github.com/deviantfero/wpgtk/wiki/Custom-Keywords

I think it should be in the last release, I'll check today to see if I
missed anything

issue.title: FlatColor material
issue.body:
I've made a fork of your FlatColor theme in this repo: [PlatColor](https://github.com/jasperro/PlatColor). I've edited it to have ripple animations, buttons with shadows and tabs with underlines. I don't know if this is the direction you want to take the theme in, but if it is, please tell me. It's still rough around the edges, and not ready to be merged. I've only edited the gtk-3.20 files so far.
![screenshot_2019-10-19-003328](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42558625/67132226-4737a500-f208-11e9-8294-29eb3dbad2ff.png)

comment.body:
Would love to hear from this as well, I haven't had time to find a new
theme to work from, and I might not be able to keep up with GTK, if anyone
has specific bugs on it, you can find more info on that by using the GTK
inspector.

That would help a lot when reporting bugs, maybe I can add that to the
README.md

issue.title: colorscheme wpgtk highligts all slashes and brackets
issue.body:
`set noshowmatch` or `:NoMatchParen` has no effect.
Also tried `:hi MatchParen ctermbg=none` and `let loaded_matchparen = 1`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76442633/143296243-87c432be-1e38-4356-b1ae-8457f1dbf779.png)

`wpgtkAlt` is working correctly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76442633/143296855-448243bc-7331-4bbe-ae6a-0ad94f92f90e.png)

comment.body:
I'm not able to reproduce this. Have you set the t_co variable?
This is what I have on my `.vimrc`

```
" color options "
"""""""""""""""""
set t_Co=256
colorscheme wpgtk
```
